revised_title: Experimental and Computational Analysis of Complex Chemical Kinetics Mechanisms
tldr: This article describes methods for the experimental and computational analysis of complex chemical kinetics problems, focusing on high-temperature chlorocarbon rearrangement and hydrocarbon cracking processes. The authors use continuous-flow uniform reaction cells and develop a mathematical model system that allows for the rapid examination of different mechanisms. The methods enable chemists to alter hypothetical reaction mechanisms and set up verifying experiments.
